did.unittitle: The Battle of Long Island: A Bird's Eye View exhibition maps and drawings
did.abstract: The collection primarily consists of a series of drawings which were used to design a map of the Battle of Long Island (also known as the Battle of Brooklyn) for a Long Island Historical Society exhibition entitled The Battle of Long Island: A Bird's Eye View, which was held at the Williamsburgh Savings Bank at One Hanson Place, Brooklyn, New York. The exhibition opened in August 1976 as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration. The map was designed by George M. Colbert. An additional map, drawn by Lucy Durand Sikes, is also included in the collection, along with an exhibition pamphlet and poster.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Exhibition pamphlet is in the public domain. Brooklyn Historical Society holds the copyright to the map drawings until 2086.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The items in this collection were created as a work-for-hire for the Long Island Historical Society (later known as Brooklyn Historical Society) in 1976. The items were transferred from the BHS map collection to the archives in January 2015.
